column4: hey somehow i can't see a nand.bin file on my sd card. i've enabled the viewing of hidden folders already. i know it's there, an extra 500mb has beeen taken up. any ideas?
hey somehow i can't see a .bin file on my sd card. i've enabled the viewing of hidden folders already. i know it's there, an extra 500mb has beeen taken up. any ideas?
mount the partiton then run: du -R *
you need to either use sudo cp or if you mount the usb properly your user will have writability. You already have read access to the logs as a user
can you provide the output of:   mount; sudo fdisk -l
use a pastebin to output all of the output
they are terminal commands
you can use sudo to gain eevated access, if you prefer gui then use: gksudo nautilus
you would be far better off mounting the usb properly but you havent given me the info i asked for
sup
hey!! ok... so i've plugged in my usb... and now i have to copy the var/log folder
can you please provide the output of: mount; sudo fdisk -l
i'll make it easy for you
sudo apt-get install pastebinit; mount > ~/temp.gfgf; sudo fdisk -l >> ~/temp.gfgf; pastebinit ~/temp.gfgf; rm ~/temp.gfgf
whats the last line in the lount command say?
that will fail as its the wrong mount point, your usb partition isnt mount to /media/disk
mount    will tell you
its something like /media/BCHAN  or something
last line
or unzip the files to home then sudo cp them
no you NEVER log on as root
you can convert the img to iso
